name: sfchronicle
text:
Gabe Kapler should be in the Manager of the Year conversation. Let that sink in for a moment.

Will he win it? None chance, as they say in the broadcast booth. But he should at least be considered, writes @JohnSheaHey. https://t.co/tOW0RyUWlC

name: sfchronicle
text:
2012: #49ers quarterback Alex Smith lost his starting job to injury and to Colin Kaepernick.

2018: C.J. Beathard lost his job to injury and to Nick Mullens.

2020: Jimmy Garoppolo … won’t lose his job to injury and to Mullens.

Story by @eric_branch: https://t.co/8HsCokPiRj

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Last month, the #LNUComplex came within 8 miles of Adventist Health St. Helena, but did not reach hospital property. This time, the #GlassFire did reach the hospital grounds, but did not appear to touch the hospital building. https://t.co/e7W3TLddgu

name: sfchronicle
text:
Madeline Buty and Jason Curliano decorated the inside of their retirement in Napa Valley with modern art. In the garage, Curliano worked on a collection of rare classic vehicles.

All of it was destroyed by the #GlassFire. https://t.co/KCzyEqAuib

name: sfchronicle
text: “There are a lot of triggers for people right now. It’s something we’ve seen, but how can you really be prepared for stuff like this?” https://t.co/EF5vUUF9Fp

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: United Airlines, which has a major hub at San Francisco International Airport, is planning to furlough more than 13,000 workers after Congress failed to pass additional coronavirus aid on Wednesday.

https://t.co/AHPM3IfWqe

name: sfchronicle
text:
California's grid operator asks customers to cut energy use on Thursday in anticipation of triple-digit heat, PG&E officials said.

A Flex Alert has been called for 3 p.m. to 10 p.m. Thursday. 

https://t.co/RCFriDwBSA

name: sfchronicle
text:
If you live in California, it’s important to be ready for a fire emergency at any time. Weather and fire conditions can change quickly, so the earlier you prepare for a possible evacuation, the better. 

Here are the things you need to do: https://t.co/QX2U2JvZ8S

name: sfchronicle
text:
California's new “health equity” metric is meant to ensure that communities of color no longer bear the brunt of the coronavirus pandemic.

Counties must meet the complicated marker before they can further reopen their economies.

https://t.co/uhTP2AIAq8

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Francisco school children were told to toss the turkey sandwiches sent home in grab-and-go bags Wednesday because of possible mold contamination.

https://t.co/x3v1TMxQu6

name: sfchronicle
text: The #GlassFire has burned 51,266 acres and was 2% contained as of Wednesday evening. The fire has destroyed 36 single-family residences in Sonoma County, destroyed 107 single-family residences in Napa County, and is threatening another 26,290 structures. https://t.co/d8ARTW047z

name: sfchronicle
text:
In St. Helena in search of the starting point for the Glass Fire, @trishathadani talks to residents, including one multiple evacuee who despairs of escaping climate-related disaster wherever she might relocate.

Listen to our Fifth & Mission podcast: https://t.co/2Qm9LCUidR

name: sfchronicle
text: “We’re familiar with all that’s happening, so we know what we’re supposed to do and think, but it isn’t easy. Honestly, we’re too familiar with this, and that’s the sad part about it.” https://t.co/dQe7SVd23v

text: In a region that has come to depend on the luxury tourism generated by the Michelin Guide and blockbuster wine labels, the destruction of the Restaurant at Meadowood represents the new tension of making a life there, writes @hooleil. https://t.co/MXAoMyN1MO

name: sfchronicle
text:
The average wind speed that aided the spread of the current Glass Fire was between five to 11 mph, with highest gust speeds up to 28 mph.

In Diablo conditions, winds can move at 30 mph with gusts clocking over 70 mph. https://t.co/tq62UPHhfh

text: “There’s no question we’re going to rebuild,” said Carlton McCoy, CEO of @BurgessCellars. “This place has been making great wines for 100 years. It’s not going to stop now.” https://t.co/dtBozxLXpz

name: sfchronicle
text: Judging by the early reviews from offseason minicamp, Andrew Wiggins is on track to make good on the Warriors’ faith in him. https://t.co/i8znyLhRA9

name: sfchronicle
text: Those who knew him said he was a humble man who wasn’t eager to embrace the strange fame that came from his experience with HIV, but who recognized that he could play an important role in drawing attention to the global battle to end AIDS. https://t.co/DBZ1ibN6gf

name: sfchronicle
text: “We want to welcome people back and assure them of their safety." https://t.co/husfXfmvd5

name: sfchronicle
text: “He changed the entire field of HIV research. He made the impossible possible. He made it possible to use the C-word: cure,” said Dr. Warner Greene, an HIV scientist at the Gladstone Institutes in San Francisco. https://t.co/tZWyQpTIiP

name: sfchronicle
text: It was the latest example of Newsom’s fondness for headline-grabbing pronouncements of “big hairy, audacious goals.” https://t.co/ULhhFYoGLB

name: sfchronicle
text: Amy Black has suffered multiple evacuations, job loss — but at least she has a home. The North Complex Fire has burned at least 770 homes in Butte County, and left hundreds of families homeless. Their options for finding housing are few. https://t.co/tSzBPAwmOl https://t.co/1SwNubSVoK

name: sfchronicle
text: Election 2020: Berkeley has a packed November ballot with police reform, taxes up for a vote. Nearly $11 million in new taxes and fees are on the ballot.  https://t.co/sE4pAI3MER https://t.co/gJ9Psspq80

name: sfchronicle
text: Election 2020: Free from prison, but still on parole means no voting rights — Proposition 17 would change that. The measure would add California to 19 states and the District of Columbia that allow former prisoners to vote while on parole. https://t.co/eTRhDJeoYO https://t.co/yH7BcEyMI2
